intro: Ganymedes ochroleucus, commonly known as the white-leaved dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and a single, elongated flower head that produces a fluffy seed dispersal mechanism. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are typically yellow, and it blooms during the warmer months of the year. Ganymedes ochroleucus is a low-growing perennial plant with a compact structure, making it well adapted to its arid environment.
